.

Differential Diagnosis. Quite similar in habitus to
S. hygropetrica
. Both species have pronotal lateral lobes that are flat, narrowly margined, and denticulate. Reliable determinations will be based on careful examination of the male genitalia, which differ in curvature and width of the main piece, and the shape of the distal piece ( Figs. 202 , 206 ).

Description . Size: holotype (length/width, mm): body (length to elytral apices) 1.67/0.68; head width 0.46; pronotum 0.39/0.52, PA 0.33, PB 0.37; elytra 0.99/0.68. Dorsum black, maxillary palpi and legs brown.

Head with labrum/clypeus/frons length rations as 10/7/10. Labrum finely, moderately sparsely punctulate, interstices shining. Clypeus and frons strongly shining, clypeus finely sparsely punctulate, frons even more sparsely punctulate, vertex nearly impunctate, size of punctures much small than 1xef. Anteocellar sulci deep. Ocelli distinct.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 200.
Sicilicula malagasica
, habitus, holotype male dorsal (right) and lateral, and female paratype (left).

subSubSection.paragraph: Elytra with disc very slightly depressed in front of midlength, sides weakly arcuate, widest at posterior 2/3, apices obliquely truncate; sutural apices minutely dehiscent; sides smooth, moderately explanate (but see female); posterior declivity gradual. Serial punctures large and deep, without discernable setae, on disc slightly larger than largest pronotal punctures, interstices about 1xpd or slightly less; without granules. Series striate-impressed, series one and two more weakly so in posterior 1/2 than other series. Intervals weakly rounded, width on disc about 2xpd, except sutural interval wider; most intervals without setae.
Mentum moderately densely punctulate, submentum much more finely and sparsely punctulate; interstices shining.

Metaventral disc with oval impression in basal 1/2. Thoracic ventrites and abdominal ventrites 1–5 clothed with dense setae except glabrous midlongitudinal prosternal ridge, glabrous dull mesoventral plaques and small glabrous strongly shining inverted V-shaped basomedian area on mesoventrite in front of intercoxal sternite. Ventrite 1 with weak sublateral and submedial basal carina on each side; ventrite 6 dull, with sparse short setae. Tibiae straight. Wings fully developed.

tr.th: ca. 0.37 mm, main piece 0.27 mm, distal process
main piece widened in distal ½;
tr.td: basal ring and basal 1/3 of main piece large; distal

subSubSection.paragraph: Female: size (length/width, mm): body (length to elytral apices) 1.79/0.74; head width 0.51; pronotum 0.42/ 0.57, PA 0.38, PB 0.39; elytra 1.07/0.74. Elytral explanate margin very wide, widest at sharply rounded posterior angles, apices markedly truncate, conjointly forming shallow arcuate line.
Etymology. Named in reference to the geographical distribution.
